title: Seven Tiles on Black Brine

quest_giver.name: Shunn Rippleborne
quest_giver.affiliation: Serene Compact - Temple of the Tidemother

description: Shattermere lies under a sky that cannot decide if it is glass or water, and today the horizon wears both like layered veils. Wind skitters over mirror-flat panes and writes bright scratches that vanish as if ashamed, while the black brine between them blinks like deep eyes that never close. Rumor runs ahead of you on blue streets: a perfect pane has lifted whole from the lake, uncracked and luminous, with inscriptions that slide under its skin like eels courting the sun. Sailors mutter that such a pane is a mouth that speaks futures, and magistrates remember how futures cut reputations sharper than glass and pretend not to listen. High Acolyte Shunn Rippleborne calls you to receive a blessing against mirages, a rite that tastes of salt and steady breath, and asks that you retrieve the pane before dusk and test the inscriptions with gratitude instead of greed. You think of the three blue bells and the hush that once came before an impossible wave, and your throat-scar hums as if a forgotten tide had found it; somewhere far off the Blue Maw holds its breath the way a judge holds a city’s name. In your palm the Azure Lens Pendant gathers an honest shard of the morning and promises to read what the lake would rather hide, and your Third-Tone Silt-Bell waits to calm any eddy that thinks itself a fate. The work ahead is simple in words and perilous in steps: find the pane, unlock its prophecy by laying seven omen-tiles in their right conversation, record any whisper of bells, the Maw, or oath-lanterns, and carry both pane and warning back under blue temple light before evening lays its own tile across the day.
objectives: Meet Shunn Rippleborne at the Glassward Infirmary for a blessing against mirages.
Travel to Shattermere and locate the unbroken pane before dusk.
Use your Azure Lens Pendant to read the pane’s submerged inscriptions.
Arrange seven omen-tiles correctly to unlock the pane’s prophecy safely.
Record any mention of bells, the Blue Maw, or oath-lanterns.
Return the pane to the Temple of the Tidemother for safekeeping.

dialogue.speaker: Shunn Rippleborne
dialogue.lines: There are mirrors that tell the truth and mirrors that tell you a version of yourself you already believed, and the worst wounds come when you mistake one for the other. Shattermere holds both with the patience of an altar and the appetite of a debt, and it charges roughly the same in coin, blood, or reputation. Kneel, Thalen Vire, and breathe with the tide while I lay the glass-light on your brow, for a steady breath is armor against mirage and a humble heart is weight against vanity. You will carry this pane as you would carry a child’s name, tenderly and with the knowledge that the sea loves to collect what is beautiful and careless in equal measure. If the inscriptions speak of bells rung in the wrong silence, hear that as a city’s throat clearing before it chokes, and answer it not with panic but with balance. Bring me gratitude carved into action rather than carved into words, and remember: the Tidemother blesses hands that return what they were never tempted to keep.

dialogue.speaker: Thalen Vire
dialogue.lines: I cracked a plate here once during a trial and I still hear it in my sleep, a thin cry that seemed to cut the day in half, so I know what it is to mistake a surface for a promise. I will not let this pane break in my hands, not for the fear of blame, but because I owe the water a better answer than my past. I will read through the Azure Lens and speak through the Third-Tone Silt-Bell if eddies curl into lies, and I will set the seven tiles like a listener arranging chairs for honest conversation. If the pane tells of the Blue Maw or of oath-lanterns straying from their duty, I will write it in strokes the city cannot pretend to misread, and I will carry it under the Temple’s blue light like a lantern that must not be jostled. I have cast a promise into the Maw to bring stillness when the bells demand, and though the sea keeps its own ledger, I intend to pay that debt with care rather than catastrophe.

dialogue.speaker: Dorn Rigger
dialogue.lines: If the pane shows a map of reflections, remember that reflections can magnify arrogance as easily as light, and the Hall keeps a model of a focusing ring we should never build because it breeds both. Do not let Mistress Prism see anything that looks like permission, not even a shadow-wink of it, because she will turn a glimmer into a blueprint and a blueprint into an accident we can only name once. Bring me a rubbing of the inscriptions and the geometry of the seven-tile layout; I want to test our safer lens standard against a future that refuses to explode instead of courting the one that begs to. Trust the silt-bell when your gut tells you to still a tremor, and trust the temple when the city tells you to hurry: both forms of caution are craft. If the pane hums wrong, touch it only with Glassthread and memory, and whatever song it sings of bells, make sure it is a choir we can live with, not a solo we will regret.

dialogue.speaker: Kelen Prism
dialogue.lines: We stand on the edge of understanding and you keep stepping back as if the edge were a cliff, Rigger, when it is in fact a bridge we are too timid to cross. If the pane reveals an alignment that can soothe or still the Maw, then a ring is not sin but salvation, and refusing to see that is the only reckless act left. Thalen, if you see a pattern that sings with our prototypes, bring it to me like a songbird that wants a wider sky, and I will make this city’s lamps sing one safe note that no storm can swallow. Let the Temple keep its rites and let the Choir knead its mud; our work is to turn brilliance into structure before fear turns structure into chains. I do not ask you to betray your caution, only to recognize when caution becomes superstition, and to choose a future where the blue light obeys intention rather than accident.

choices.title: Accept Shunn’s full rite and vow gratitude over gain
choices.text: You bow your head in the Glassward Infirmary and let the blue panes sieve the light into calm, agreeing to carry the pane as a trust rather than a trophy. You promise to lay the seven tiles with the same patience you use to settle quarrels, letting each symbol answer the others until meaning breathes evenly. You decide to read the inscriptions only at slack water, speaking through the Conch so that the lake’s voice and yours share the same breath and the same boundaries. You will refuse any shortcut that tastes of haste, even if the sun slides toward dusk and the brine begins to throw mirage-doors into your path. When you retrieve the pane, you will tie it to your will with gratitude, not with fear, so that the sea has no cause to reclaim what you only meant to borrow.
choices.outcome: The blessing settles on you like a second pulse, and when you reach Shattermere the mirages blink and bow instead of biting, letting you step across the plates with deliberate grace. The seven tiles, arranged as a river-law debate with the seventh laid last like a verdict, unlock a soft glow and a whisper that names three blue bells, the hush between them, and a lantern that has forgotten the shape of its own oath. Through the Lens you record the phrases precisely, noting a caution that the wrong silence will call the right storm, and an image of the Maw turning slower for one breath if the city breathes with it instead of against it. You return the pane intact to the Temple, and Shunn’s gratitude binds a small circle of protection around your name in the Serene Compact; Kelen fumes but cannot fault success shaped like care. In streets and chambers, whispers carry your restraint farther than your steps, and doors that lean toward faith open a little easier when you knock.

choices.title: Divert briefly to the Hall and test a cautious alignment with Kelen
choices.text: You send word to Mistress Prism that you will stop by the Hall of Subtle Artifice with the pane for an hour, swearing no drills will blare and no ring will be lit. You lay ground rules like stones in a shallow ford: you keep the pane, you keep the timing, and any song that grows sharp is muted at once. Kelen assembles a quiet array of lenses and frames, promising to match the pane’s gentleness with the same, and you oblige because knowledge without fear is kin to wisdom. You keep Dorn’s warning in your ear like a measured heartbeat, refusing every step that moves faster than your breath, and you let the seven tiles lie nearby like witnesses reminding all present of law. You vow to return the pane to the Temple before dusk no matter what brilliance strains to be born in the workshop’s blue light.
choices.outcome: The test hums like a held note and, for a heartbeat, the pane and the prototype agree enough that the Lens shows a possible chord that would steady the Maw without silencing the city. Then a hairline of cold creeps under the glass like a splinter of winter and you ring the silt-bell, stilling the tremor before it can choose to be a crack or a curse. Kelen’s eyes shine with a blueprint she swears can be tamed, while your caution writes the measurements down without offering permission, leaving her with a promise to revisit only if no other path closes the wound. You return the pane to the Temple on time, earning a measured nod from Shunn and a thin-pursed reserve that says trust is a vessel that must be refilled after every pour. In the days after, apprentices whisper your name like a hinge between caution and courage, and both the Hall and the Temple find reason to invite you into rooms where the next decisions will be made.

choices.title: Call upon the Choir of Silt to read the water’s memory first
choices.text: You send a runner upriver-bent and meet Delta-Keeper Ys Hul at the lake’s lip, inviting the river to stand in counsel with the sea. You lay the seven tiles in a current-witness pattern the Choir teaches, letting silt settle into each groove until the tiles feel heavy with testimony rather than hungry for spectacle. You read the inscriptions through river-light instead of sky-light, choosing a perspective that remembers debts and timings more than glamor and fear. Your silt-bell keeps time with bell-ringers in drowned stair-villages, and for a moment the wind seems to carry a terrace choir into the basin where your knees have pressed two neat ovals. You promise that whatever the pane reveals about bells, the Maw, or oath-lanterns will be weighed like water-rights, with balance owed in both directions and recorded for those who live by flow instead of flame.
choices.outcome: The pane warms to the river’s patience and gives you a prophecy that tastes of mud and law: ring the first bell to loose guilt, the second to bind promise, and the third only when river and sea both consent to be still. It shows an oath-lantern caught in a net of contracts that tug it away from its pier, and a bleed-valve hidden in a whispering spine of stone, and you write both down with the care of one who knows leaks by their sound. Ys Hul marks your notes with a river-sign that the Temple recognizes but the Ledger does not own, and when you return the pane to Shunn, she smiles as if an old quarrel has remembered how to sit. The Choir’s favor follows you in terraces and wells, while Ledger masks begin to watch you as if water had learned your footfall, and the city’s arguments grow slightly more specific wherever you stand. Nights later, your dreams place seven tiles on the aqueduct’s shadow, and you wake knowing a gate you can open without drowning either side.

choices.title: Use hush and shadow to outpace dusk and the faceless pilgrim
choices.text: You purchase a pinch of hush-ink and draw a ring on your palm that will swallow sound for a count of one hundred, deciding to walk the panes inside that bubble like a thief inside a chapel. You time your steps to the Conch’s silence rather than its voice, knowing that quiet can keep you from waking the mirage fish that mistake footsteps for bait. You keep your Lens hooded until you kneel by the perfect pane, letting your fingertips memorize the inscriptions before your eyes grow greedy, and you lay the seven tiles in the pattern your hands learned. The faceless pilgrim begins its dusk-count at the lakeside and your scar hums a warning that each number will try to claim your name if the silence falters, so you guard it with breath and will. You promise yourself the hush will serve gratitude rather than theft, and that you will leave no debt behind that you would not let your own reflection collect from you.
choices.outcome: Inside the hush, the world narrows to panes and pulse, and the prophecy unlocks with a sigh that feels like a tide turning in a bottle: three bells must never sound over a bought silence, or the Blue Maw will answer with a debt no ledger can price. The Lens shows an oath-lantern trembling on a chain and a city’s breath catching when a hidden hand holds a valve too long for profit, and you ink the shapes into your reed-scroll with strokes that know the cost of erasure. When the hush ends, the pilgrim finishes its count and passes you like a shadow that recognizes restraint, leaving only the taste of cold on your name that fades by dawn. You return the pane to the Temple swiftly and intact, and Shunn blesses you for speed governed by reverence; in the caverns, Syndicate eyes mark your method and learn a lesson you may not like them to keep. From then on, whenever you near the Blue Maw, the quiet seems to tip its hat rather than bare its teeth, as if it remembers the day you made silence keep a promise instead of break it.

rewards.description: Set of Seven Augury Tiles: once per day, arrange them to reveal a safe route across hazardous ground; their guidance is subtle but steady, like a tide that presses rather than pulls.
+1 standing with the Serene Compact: priests and mediators regard you with warmer light, easing rites, audiences, and sanctuary when storms turn civic.
Glassward Salve: a sealed phial whose blue sheen, when breathed and rubbed at the throat and ribs, prevents one instance of glass-lung or ash sting.
Shattermere Inscription Rubbing: a faithful transfer of the pane’s script that aids a later ritual involving bells, the Blue Maw, and oath-lantern alignments.
